physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white portrait photograph of a woman. She is photographed wearing a long, striped dress, with accessories on her head, earrings, necklaces, and bracelets. She is standing in the middle of a room, with a short decorative column on the left, a vase on the column, and a furniture with a textile draped over it on the right. There are no inscriptions on the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen.
sgcool_label_text: This carte-de-visite format photograph was taken in the studio of John Thomson, who arrived in Singapore in 1862 and established a studio at Beach Road on 16 June that year. Thomson would later travel to photograph in Siam and China before embarking on a series on street life in London.
title_text: Portrait of a woman Photograph of woman in long striped dress
subject_terms_2: Carte de visite photographs Portrait photography Ethnic costume
